info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 11:46PM CDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Drakes Creek near Alvaton affecting Warren County.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Barren River at Bowling Green affecting Warren County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Rough River near Dundee affecting Ohio County.
.Heavy rain from the past week has caused the river to rise.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Rough River near Dundee.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, County roads between Dundee and Narrows flood. At 26.0 feet, County roads near Sunnydale flood. At 27.0 feet, KY 919 flood at Underwood and Clifty Huff Roads near Narrows. At 28.0 feet, Trailer courts in Hartford flood. At 29.0 feet, KY 136 at Heflin Road floods near county line. KY 69 floods near intersection of US 231 in Hartford. At 30.0 feet, US 231 floods at shopping center between Hartford and Beaver Dam.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 29.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 23.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 PM CDT Sunday was 29.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 27.3 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.1 feet on 06/29/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Monday afternoon at 1245 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
